creditline: Gift of funds from Siri and Bob Marshall
description: waterscape with sailboat in lower L corner, reflected on the calm water; upper 2/3 of image is sky that gradually changes from light pink at horizon to light gray at the top of image; pink of sky reflected in the water along bottom of image; in a gold frame with decorative grooved moulding; D-rings and wire attached
markings: verso BC of frame: SULLIVAN GOSS / AN AMERICAN GALLERY / SANTA BARBARA, CA
text: Lockwood de Forest was a key figure in the spreading of Orientalism in the decorative arts in the United States. Having traveled extensively through Italy, the Near East, North of Africa, and India, he began his career as a painter influenced by Frederic Church and other artists from the Hudson River School. This painting was made during a trip to Egypt in 1876, when the artist produced a series of sketches of the banks of the Nile River under different effects of light, some of which he would later use as basis for studio paintings.
title: Lone Felucca at Dusk near Roda along the Nile (study)
